document.heading: Pretrial Detention Reporting Emergency Amendment Act of 2026
To amend, on an emergency basis, section 1505 of the Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for the District of Columbia Establishment Act of 2001 to clarify certain reporting requirements.
document.text: BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Pretrial Detention Reporting Emergency Amendment Act of 2026".

section.text: Section 1505 of the Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for the District of Columbia Establishment Act of 2001, effective October 3, 2001 (D.C. Law 14-28; D.C. Official Code ยง 22-4234), is amended as follows:

para.text: The lead-in language is amended by striking the phrase "no later than 180 days after the applicability date of section 30(f), (g), and (h) of the Secure DC Omnibus Amendment Act of 2024, passed on 2nd reading on March 5, 2024 (Enrolled version of Bill 24-345) ("Secure DC Omnibus")" and inserting the phrase "no later than September 30, 2026" in its place.

Paragraph (2) is amended by striking the phrase "and after the effective date of the Secure DC Omnibus" and inserting the phrase ", after the effective date of the Prioritizing Public Safety Emergency, and after the effective date of the Secure DC Omnibus" in its place.

Paragraph (6) is amended by striking the phrase "and after the applicability date of section 28 of the Secure DC Omnibus" and inserting the phrase ", after the effective date of the Prioritizing Public Safety Emergency, and after the effective date of the Secure DC Omnibus" in its place.

Paragraph (7) is amended by striking the phrase "and after the applicability date of section 28 of the Secure DC Omnibus" and inserting the phrase ", after the effective date of the Prioritizing Public Safety Emergency, and after the effective date of the Secure DC Omnibus" in its place.

section.heading: Applicability.
section.text: This act shall apply as of January 1, 2025.

section.heading: Fiscal impact statement.
section.text: The Council adopts the fiscal impact statement of the Budget Director as the fiscal impact statement required by section 4a of the General Legislative Procedures Act of 1975, approved October 16, 2006 (120 Stat. 2038; D.C. Official Code ยง 1-301.47a).

section.heading: Effective date.
section.text: This act shall take effect following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto), and shall remain in effect for no longer than 90 days, as provided for emergency acts of the Council of the District of Columbia in section 412(a) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 788; D.C. Official Code ยง 1-204.12(a)).
